title: Day 1107
content:
# Day 1107

Today, I watched the film _Mickey 17_ with my love. It was a captivating experience, and I couldn't help but reflect on the thought-provoking themes it presented. Having enjoyed _Parasite_ from the same director, Bong Joon Ho, I knew I was in for something intriguing.

The movie explores the ethical dilemma of 3D printing humans and the concept of being "expendable." It left me questioning how I would feel in that position. Personally, I don't think I would sign up to be considered "expendable". It is a very haunting idea. The film's unique take on human replication made me think about what it truly means to be irreplaceable.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*Ek2KiE0yPZq85DorBC_CpA.png)

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*jaw8O-LY_jvMIgVrj3Uejg.png)

It was a compelling watch.

4/2/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
